intro: Colubrina napalensis, commonly known as the Napo colubrina, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Colubrina napalensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
